tourName: Southern England luxury self drive vacation
generalInfo: This expertly curated seventeen-day escape takes you through some of England’s most captivating landscapes, where history, culture, and natural beauty unfold at every turn. Begin in London, discovering the nation’s vibrant capital before journeying into East Sussex, with its storybook villages, medieval castles, and striking white cliffs. Walk in the footsteps of conquerors at the Battle of Hastings before winding through the lush hills of West Sussex, along the windswept Jurassic Coast of Dorset, and into the rolling charm of the Cotswolds. Meander cobbled streets, uncover the secrets of country estates and slow down in riverside villages like Henley-on-Thames.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in London: A private transfer will take you to your central hotel, your base for the next four nights. After settling in, step out to experience the energy of London, a city rich in history and culture. Kick things off with a ride on the London Eye for sweeping city views, then unwind over dinner at a top-rated local restaurant. Accommodation: Henrietta Hotel, 11 Cadogan Gardens or similar

London Walking Tour: After breakfast, set off on a private guided walk led by a certified Blue Badge Guide. Begin at the historic Westminster Abbey, known for royal ceremonies, then head to Buckingham Palace to see the Changing of the Guard. Continue with a visit to the Churchill War Rooms, a key WWII site, before wrapping up the day amid the shops, street performers, and cafés of lively Covent Garden.

Explore London’s historic sites: Begin your day at the Tower of London to explore centuries of royal history and the dazzling Crown Jewels. Then, join a small group food tour near London Bridge, taste British favourites at Borough Market and relax with a drink in a classic pub. Later, visit the magnificent St Paul’s Cathedral, including its iconic dome and crypt, before ending the evening with a spectacular performance in the West End.

Drive to East Sussex: Today, you’ll collect your car rental from a depot point in London and then drive to a charming countryside hotel in East Sussex. Over the next few days, explore the beauty and history of Sussex - enjoy a pint in a pub with views of the South Downs, stroll through quaint towns, and taste world-class wines. In the evenings, dine at a Tudor inn in the historic village of Alfriston, where the atmosphere and food are exceptional. Accommodation: The Star Alfriston or similar

Explore the Sussex Coast: Spend the day at the stunning Seven Sisters, a series of iconic white chalk cliffs where the South Downs meet the sea. Then, visit the Rathfinny Estate, a picturesque vineyard near Alfriston, known for producing some of England’s finest sparkling wines. Enjoy a guided vines tour, learn about their sustainable viticulture methods, and explore the winery. End with a tasting of exceptional Sussex wines paired with modern British cuisine at the estate’s Tasting Rooms, offering a perfect blend of local flavours and wines.

Visit the Battle of Hastings: Explore the historic site of the 1066 Battle of Hastings, where William the Conqueror marked his victory with the impressive Battle Abbey. Next, visit a nearby 14th-century castle with a moat, spiral staircases, and battlements, offering a glimpse into medieval life. In Rye, stroll through cobbled streets and hidden alleys, stopping at ancient pubs along Mermaid Street. Visit Ypres Tower to uncover the town's rich history of smuggling, shipwrecks, and invasions.

Continue into West Sussex: Today, you’ll explore the rolling hills and rich history of the South Downs. Visit Lewes, a medieval town with independent shops, antique centres, and a Norman castle offering panoramic views and a small museum. Next, head to Arundel Castle, perched high with stunning views of the South Downs and River Arun. Spend the evening at a cosy country house hotel or stay in a medieval castle. Accommodation: Park House Hotel, Amberley Castle or similar

Discover the beauty of West Sussex: Visit Petworth House, a 17th-century mansion with an impressive art collection, including works by Van Dyck and Turner. Outside, enjoy the Pleasure Garden, woodland walks, and a 700-acre Deer Park by Capability Brown. Then head to the Weald and Downland Living Museum, where traditional buildings and exhibits showcase over 1,000 years of rural life, including a Tudor farmstead, medieval houses, and workshops with traditional crafts.

Visit Portsmouth: Explore one of the UK’s top naval history sites, the Historic Dockyard, home to iconic ships like the Mary Rose, HMS Victory, and HMS Warrior. With a Three Attraction Pass, visit these ships or learn about the D-Day invasion at The D-Day Story Museum. Then, head to Dorset, famous for its golden beaches and Jurassic coastline. Accommodation: The Priory, The Pig on the Beach or similar

Explore the Jurassic Coast: Spend the day discovering one of England's most scenic coastlines, rich in history spanning millions of years. Visit Lulworth Cove, known for its breathtaking views and unique geology, with white cliffs and turquoise waters. Stroll along the semi-circular beach and take in the views from the spectacular viewpoint. Next, explore Durdle Door, a 200ft natural rock arch formed 10,000 years ago. Lastly, visit Corfe Castle, a dramatic medieval ruin dominating the Purbeck Hills, surrounded by the charming village of Corfe with its quaint streets and traditional cottages.

Discover the Fossil Haven of Lyme Regis: Explore this charming seaside town on the Jurassic Coast, famous for fossil hunting, beaches, and coastal walks. Stroll past colourful houses and the quaint harbour, then take a boat trip from Lyme Regis Harbour, enjoying views of Ware Cliffs, Chippel Bay, and Golden Cap while your captain shares stories of local history, smuggling, and shipwrecks.

Journey to Bath: Travel north towards Bath, detouring to some of the prettiest Cotswold villages, including the postcard-perfect villages of Castle Combe and Lacock. Discover Lacock Abbey, which is rich in history and linked to photography pioneer William Henry Fox Talbot. After a scenic day exploring, arrive in Bath and settle into your hotel near the heart of the UNESCO-listed city centre. Accommodation: The Roseate Villa, The Royal Crescent Hotel & Spa or similar

Explore Bath’s History: Take a guided walking tour through Bath’s historic streets, learning about its literary legends like Jane Austen and Mary Shelley while admiring the city’s elegant Georgian architecture and the iconic Royal Crescent. Pause for a classic afternoon tea at The Pump Rooms, a long-standing social landmark, before exploring the Roman Baths - an impressively preserved glimpse into Britain’s ancient past.

Step into the Heart of the Cotswolds: Wander through rolling hills, ancient limestone villages, and medieval market towns on your way to Broadway. Visit Bibury with its iconic Arlington Row cottages, Bourton-on-the-Water, known as the "Little Venice" for its picturesque bridges, and Stow-on-the-Wold, a historic market town at the highest point of the Cotswolds. Enjoy scenic walks, local ales at thatched inns, and rich history before relaxing at the historic Lygon Arms Hotel in Broadway, nestled right on the High Street, or Dormy House nearby. Accommodation: The Lygon Arms Hotel, Dormy House, or similar

Explore Broadway: Stroll through this charming Cotswold village with honey-coloured cottages and tree-lined High Street, loved by Edward Elgar and William Morris. Visit Broadway Tower, a 19th-century folly offering panoramic views of 12 counties and a 50-acre estate. Enjoy a classic Afternoon Tea at the historic Lygon Arms, where Oliver Cromwell once stayed, and indulge in freshly baked scones, sandwiches, and cakes.

Visit Blenheim Palace: Explore this UNESCO World Heritage Site, birthplace of Winston Churchill and home to the Duke of Marlborough. Admire its Baroque architecture, gilded rooms, priceless art, and the gardens designed by 'Capability' Brown. End your day in Henley-on-Thames, a charming riverside town known for its award-winning gardens and the famous Regatta. Accommodation: The Relais Henley or similar
Bid farewell to England: Today, you’ll drop off your hire car at the airport and catch your flight home.
